b"No meaningful attainment of sustainable world dev't can be achieved without equal participation of women in all segments of human endeavour."
b'Empowerment of women is not a privilege. It is a right.'
b'Ethiopia- 75% of labour on coffee farms women but earn only 34% of the income.'
b'E.g. Cote D\xe2\x80\x99Ivoire- 60% of labour on cocoa farms women but earn only 21% of the income.'
b'Distribution of income in the agricultural value chain in many cases is tilted against women.'
b'Most land holding systems are male dominated. Women also have limited access to technology for modernized agriculture.'
b'Africa\xe2\x80\x99s land tenure systems make it difficult for women to access and own land for agricultural purposes.'
b'At the last @AfDB_Group Board meeting in India, we concluded that to attract the interest of the youth, agriculture must be cool or sexy'
b'To achieve this not only women but also the youth must be attracted to invest and participate in agricultural production.'
b'The available arable land means Africa has the potential to, not only feed itself but, feed the rest of the world.'
b'Africa possesses about 600 million hectares of uncultivated arable land, amounting to about 60% of the world total.'
b'It is more predominant in certain aspects along the agricultural value chain, e.g. processing and marketing.'
b'Participation of women in agricultural production in Africa is between 40% and 60%.'
b'This Summit appropriately focuses on Women, Agriculture & sustainable development. In no sector is the participation of women more critical'
b'Women must have the right & control to decide the number of children they want, & unfettered access to birth control methods & facilities'
b'The practice of taking young girls out of school midstream and marrying them off mostly to men far older than them must stop.'
b'Girls must not only be made to go to school, but must also stay in school for as far as their capacity for academic pursuit can take them.'
b'One of the most backward & unacceptable practices is child marriage. This must be a cause that we take up with passion.'
b'An our girls are continuing in school to secondary and tertiary levels.'
